metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13173 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
fstream before 1.0.12 is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Overwrite. Extracting tarballs containing a hardlink to a file that already exists in the system, and a file that matches the hardlink, will overwrite the system's file with the contents of the extracted file. The fstream.DirWriter() function is vulnerable. It was discovered that npm/fstream incorrectly handled certain crafted tarballs. An attacker could use this vulnerability to write aritrary files to the filesystem.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-fstream - 1.0.12-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> According to a Github comment, the fix might not be enough.

criterions.comment: node-fstream package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.12-1').
